title: balakirev
author: balakirev
content: After localcryptos.com closed down I am trying to get an overview over which exchanges, forums, discussion groups etc that facilitate in-person cash transactions for bitcoin.localcoinswap.com is the only one I've found so far.Any other leads, anyone?

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Look into the list on kycnot.me particularly BISQ, agoradesk.com and hodlhodl.com as last I check, they support this.Robosats (use the onion site) allows manual input of payment method so it should work too.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: balakirev on September 01, 2023, 08:10:32 PMAny other leads, anyone?It all depends on location where you live, but there are several options currently available.Bisq decentralized exchange is one of the best option that runs on computers, and you can create your own offers or accept them from other people.Downside is that you have to download and install software, wait to sync, and later deposit bitcoin before you can trade.Â Peachbitcoin.com is a good mobile app if you live in Europe, and it has many option for exchanging including cash in person.It has verifiable source code and it's really easy to use, but like I side before it is not available outside Europe (for now).AgoraDesk is very similar with localcryptos, so I would check that out, and there is Robosats if you want to trade using Lightning Network.

comments.author: GreenInk
comments.body: Sorry, but all those sites are rubbish.THey have no meaningfull buying/selling power.full of scammers
